author: Georgina Torbet
title: Kepler telescope shuts down, but endows all its data to the public
description: NASA's Kepler telescope has been decommissioned after nine years of hunting for planets outside of our solar system. The mission was only expected to last 3.5 years but ended up successfully transmitting data for much longer. Now all of that data is made publ…
content: After a nine-year mission into deep space to hunt for planets, the Kepler space telescope has finally been decommissioned. Having discovered more than 2,600 planets outside of our solar system, the telescope has finally run out of fuel and will cease operatio… [+1985 chars]

author: Editorial
title: Shuteye for Kepler
description: Nasa has lost its pioneering planet-hunter, but TESS has already picked up the baton
content: By: Editorial | Updated: November 3, 2018 12:18:06 am The space telescope, which will now lie dormant in solar orbit for ever unless it becomes a tourist attraction in about a century had been faltering for some time. This week, Nasa shut down the Kepler spac… [+1777 chars]

author: Matt Williams
title: It’s Over For Kepler. The Most Successful Planet Hunter Ever Built is Finally out of Fuel and Has Just Been Shut Down.
description: After eight years of service and thousands of exoplanet discoveries, the Kepler space telescope has run out of fuel and will be retired. The post It’s Over For Kepler. The Most Successful Planet Hunter Ever Built is Finally out of Fuel and Has Just Been Shut …

author: Kit Daniels
title: NASA’s Kepler telescope retires after finding thousands of worlds
description: Kepler leaves a legacy of more than 2,600 planet discoveries
content: Kepler leaves a legacy of more than 2,600 planet discoveries After nine years in deep space collecting data that indicate our sky to be filled with billions of hidden planets – more planets even than stars – NASA’s Kepler space telescope has run out of fuel n… [+5597 chars]

title: “Open to the Public” –Kepler Mission Alien Planets: 'Many are Still Hiding in the Data' - The Daily Galaxy

content: “The search for exoplanets using the Kepler data is still underway. Many are still hiding in the data, ready to be discovered,” said Susan Mullally, a scientist working on the Kepler mission at STScI. All four years of the Kepler primary mission data as well … [+3564 chars]

author: The Hindu Net Desk
title: Adieu and Thank You, Kepler
description:
On October 30, 2018, NASA announced that its Kepler space telescope has run out of fuel and that it will retire the spacecraft.
Here are a few things, Kepler taught us in its nine years of deep space
